title: Hussein Ibish - Part II: Avoiding Hagiography & 'More Honor'd in the Breach'
description:
Hussein Ibish is a Senior Resident Scholar at The Arab Gulf States Institute in Washington DC, columnist for Bloomberg, as well as the UAE publication The National. He recently joined TheCommonToad podcast to discuss his friendship with legendary writer Christopher Hitchens, the calamities of the Trump administration, and U.S. policies in the Middle East.

This is Part II of II

0:30 – Hitchens's support of the Iraq War: “He was attached to his mistake”
4:02 – The core reason for his support? The Kurds.
8:50 – The Neocon-Marxist connection
14:09 – Why are the Neocons ultimately wrong?
21:44 – The Middle East and the US today and beyond
25:09 – Iran, sanctions, and the assassination of Soleimani 
34:57 – Ibish on American power: there's nowhere to go but down
44:32 – Americans' fantasies of global disengagement is a bad idea, but understandable
49:00 – Hussein: Biden's lead is stable, Trump's law and order scaremongering isn't sticking
55:46 – When Ibish taught Hitchens something about Shakespeare


https://www.thecommontoad.com/post/conversations-hussein-ibish-part-11-avoiding-hagiography-more-honor-d-in-the-breach
